facts.1: National Workaholics Day is observed to recognize the dedication of workaholics and the impact their work habits can have on their health and relationships.
facts.2: There is no formal recognition by the government, but it has been adopted by various organizations to promote a healthier work-life balance.
facts.3: This day serves as a reminder to the workaholics to take a break and consider the importance of leisure time and personal life.

facts.1: Constitution Day in Armenia celebrates the adoption of the nation's constitution on July 5th, 1995, after gaining independence from the Soviet Union.
facts.2: It is a national holiday in Armenia, featuring parades, fireworks, concerts, and public ceremonies.
facts.3: The Constitution established Armenia as a democratic, sovereign, social, and constitutional state, marking a significant step in the post-Soviet era.

facts.1: Tynwald Day is the National Day of the Isle of Man, usually observed on July 5th. It is one of the island's bank holidays.
facts.2: The day is marked by a ceremonial meeting of the Tynwald, which is the oldest continuous parliamentary body in the world, having started its tradition over 1,000 years ago.
facts.3: The open-air Tynwald Day ceremony includes a procession, a fair, and cultural events, representing the island's autonomy and its Norse-Gaelic origins.
